p: GSH synthesis involves the two important enzymes glutamate-cysteine ligase (GCL) and GSS. GCL is the rate-limiting enzyme in GSH biosynthesis and is composed of catalytic and modifier subunits, GCLC and GCLM ( 51). Gclc heterozygous mice have decreased levels of GCLC protein, and of GSH ( 52). Thus, reductions of GSH may be caused lowered Gclc expression. In this study, expression of Gclc, Gclm, and Gss was significantly decreased in liver-specific Phb1 +/âˆ’ mice fed the SPD compared with the normal diet. Therefore, soy protein likely reduces GSH through decreasing Gclc, Gclm, and Gss in liver-specific Phb1 deficient mice.
